Transcription_Text: Welcome, everyone, to today's special edition of Critical Role, where a number of us are going to be playing a fantastic game in the realm of Mordor, thanks to our fantastic sponsor for this event, WB Games!
We're putting this together in celebration of the release of their upcoming game, Shadow of War, for Xbox and Playstation, which all of us have worked on, actually, for an extended period of time.
Well, first off, Travis, who'd you play in the game?
I played Commanding Orc #1, and I scream like this and I will be chasing you as you try and make your way through the lands, and I escalate my ambitions through the war ranks!
Laura, who'd you play in the game?
I play Eltariel, also known as the Blade of Galadriel.
I'm a super cool and I have, like, daggers, and I can kick a lot of butt.
That's a great little view of the character, there.
That's exactly how I recorded it.
I played a character named Orc 4, who, among other things, hates humans.
How does he feel about elves?
Oh, I think he hates them?
I think he hates most things.
Really, they should spend more of the game talking about his wants and needs, and his ambitions and likes in life, but no.
Does he hate the player, or does he hate the game?
Just hates a lot of stuff.
What'd you play in the game?
I am a massive olog, but he became-- one of them became kind of notorious.
There were tribute videos to Az-Laar.
People played sad music when Az-Laar died.
(deep gruff voice) A big dumb thing, but he died from flames!
(normal voice) And people were very upset, so they were playing tinkling music and going, Rest in Peace, Az-Laar!
I was not in the previous.
I had not come to California yet.
I was still in New York going, I really hope I get to do stuff like that!
You hear Darin and you're like, he was definitely an orc forever.
It's only been, it's a little over four years that I have been among the people that I admire most.
It makes my heart so happy.
And we haven't even started the episode.
But glad you could join us, Darin.
I play a professional orc who's going to follow you around everywhere, trying make sure that you're working it out.
I'm going to cut your throat, bastard!
And I also get to play-- I'm really excited about this, as a longtime Tolkien fan-- the Witch-king of Angmar, head of the Nazg≈±l.

As a person that grew up reading Tolkien fervently and spending two and a half years playing a MUD based on Tolkien, and then, you know, the movies and everything-- huge honor to be a part of this, let alone such an iconic character.
Super excited for this game, and those of you who haven't played the first game, Shadow of Mordor, what's wrong with you?
It's legitimately a really fun game and this one expands even more on how awesome that was, so super excited.
Thank you so much to WB Games for making this possible.
You guys can check it out, Shadow of War releases October 10th, which is right around the corner when this is airing, which is exciting.
You can find it at shadowofwar.com/purchase to go ahead and find out how to buy and pre-order it if you want to.

But yeah, this whole game is a big celebration of the upcoming release of Shadow of War.
We're stoked to be in it, and we're stoked to have you here.
Without further ado, guys, let's go ahead and dive into the world of Mordor, shall we?
Actually, before we begin, because we haven't actually established here, do you guys want to talk about who you're playing in this game?
Oh gosh, I guess we should, being that we don't even know.
We're figuring it out as we go.
(high squeaky voice) So I'm playing: I am Skak Scar-Artist, and I'm a goblin.
I'm a little goblin that's got a crossbow and a shortsword, and I'm here to run amok and advance, you know, my efforts against the horrible humans and elves of the land of Mordor.
This could be my favorite day ever.
I'm already so invested in everything.
I'm the Unbreakable because people have tried but nobody was able to actually break me.
I'm olog-hai, so I'm kind of big.
But you know, I don't necessarily want to be a fighter, I'm just really good at it, you know?
There's two things you have to know about me.
My name is Mozuu the Chosen, and that's it!
And Sam, who are you playing?
My name is Ur-Eden Goodthink, and I'm the olog you want to see if you're hurt.
I'm an olog, so I'm rather big.
But I'm also a sawbones, which means if you have a toothache or something, you come to me, I pull the tooth right out.
Probably half of your jaw, too.
If you got a broken bone, I pull the arm off.
If you got a rash, I pull your skin off.
So really, I take care of all your medical needs.
Somebody came to me with-- they were having some stress dreams.
Usually most things can be solved without insurance.
But yeah, I'm here to help anyone who gets injured, and also to kill some man-filth.
Players and audience, welcome to Mordor.

Chosen as the base to Sauron's foothold in the Second Age, these broken, ashen lands to the southeast of Middle-earth lay guarded by towering mountain ranges, ever dark beneath stormclouds and volcanic smoke spewed from within the fiery depths of Orodruin, or Mount Doom.
Here in the Third Age, the once-thought-destroyed Dark Lord regains his strength, grows his armies, and prepares for his vengeance on the world of man and elves.
You, friends, are soldiers and warriors under this shadowed banner.

Whether Uruk- or Olog-hai, you've been raised and trained in the savage pits and fields of these lands, given purpose amongst the ranks of Sauron's great army, taught to slaughter, to devour, to outsmart and destroy all who would oppose his will, or be punished for your insolence.

You relish the thought of sinking your blades into elf-flesh, eager for the chance to prove yourself and rise among your fellow uruk to command greater power-- and the rewards that come with it, of course.
However, such a path is not as easy as the daydream would lead you to believe.
Now, you four have spent months stationed on the outskirts of the watch-fortress of Nargaroth, on the eastern edge of the massive Plateau of Gorgoroth, many miles southeast of Mount Doom.

As part of the Marauder tribe, you've been sent on a few raids here and there, between here and the Sea of Nurnen, scrounging up what meager spoils are left when the bulk is brought to the feet of your war-chief, Barfta the Blood Pike.
While you both dislike and respect his greed, you've seen him carve every challenger to his position to pieces as a show of power.
You hope to show him your worth and achieve greatness under his specific banner.
At least, that would help you with your limited access to quality meats or being sent out on aimless patrols that try your patience.

For now, you sit amongst the rowdy riff-raff of the common tables in the fort courtyard, drinking from watered-down grog as you all celebrate a fairly unimpressive crushing of a not-too-far-away ghul mound.
You four have bonded out of a need for allies, for boredom here leads to violence, and it's good to have friends when the brawls begin.
The late afternoon sees fading off what specter of sunlight ever finds itself in Mordor, and the smell of burnt meats and blood fills the air.
You hear the clanking of glasses and partially cracked mugs nearby.
The cheers and rowdy screams and yells of various half-drunken uruk in your vicinity, (shouting).
You see two guys in the back far corner that are in the middle of a fist-fight with a small crowd gathering, but it's too measly for your attention.
You all sit here, staring into your cups, contemplating your existence.
Do you want to go with me to kill something?
Well, those two fellows having the fist fight, we could go kill one of them.
I think it's Rarr versus Oog, over there.
Naw, I think it's Oog, and it's actually Oop-tha.
Yeah, you get them easily confused.
Is that what you really want?
You just want to fight and bleed for nothing, or do we want gold?
And I say we find it.
While they're fighting and they're dying for nothing, we make our way up and we rule this world, eh?
But I thought Barfta ruled this world.
There's two things you have to know about Barfta.
He keeps doing this, with the two things.
You're always-- I'm a fan of gold as well.
You see this gold helmet that I stole?
Don't mind the man-filth head on the pike on the helmet, ha!
But you know what you aren't?
You aren't the head of man-filth on my helmet.
And while we're alive, we make a difference.
It's that exact moment that a heavy nudge slaps into the back of Mozuu.

You watch a familiar, lanky, nasty-looking uruk with large, broken teeth and a wiry physicality slamming into him, his large cup of thick, brackish grog spilling over and across your shoulder as he spins around to stare down at you, Mozuu.
You recognize this as Hoshgrish Bootlick.
What you doing, bumping my drink, lob?
Oh, I'm doing just fine right here!
Will you go ahead and refill my drink!
And he puts his cup right on the table in front of you.
Refill his drink while I have a little word with Hoshgrish.
Could I have, could you hand me--?
It's really high up there, right.
We're just sitting here having a little discussion.
You wander up drunkenly, you bump into me!
At least you didn't get wine on the helmet.
And now you're looking for trouble?
Is that what you're looking for, Hoshgrish Bootlick?
As he wipes the bit of spittle from the bottom of his pointed, jagged chin, he looks down at you with a sly grin, his overbite curling back as it exposes with the smile.
You obviously haven't seen the last one who bumped into me when I was drinking!
So you want to start a problem?
He takes a few steps back and you watch as his hands go down to pull two jagged, black blades from the side.
He spins and tosses them in the air and catches them.
You mess with Mozuu, you mess with me.
Well look here, I don't have any sort of a problem with you, friend olog, but you understand.
I've had my drink disrespected and I'll take a head for that!
Oh, well, he was, his drink was disrespected, that's all it is.
Skak, you got that drink for him yet?
Was I supposed to do that?
Yeah, hold on one more second.
We'll refill your drink, friend, but know, they call me Mozuu the Chosen because Sauron spoke to me.
The strong take what they want.
The Dark Lord spoke to you?
He puts his blades back in, like now disinterested, completely shut off from the conversation.
Turns around and starts walking away.
Did Sauron really talk to you?
Everything I say is true, except the things that ain't, but that is true.
Because sometimes I hear voices, but then I turn around and it's just an orc talking to me that I didn't see.
Sometimes I'm talking to you, sometimes but--
Yeah, but I didn't see you.
Because your helmet blocks the view, you know.
Yeah, that's the problem with these things.
We all hear voices when people are talking in our general vicinity, but this was in my head.
This was in my head, I heard it.
He sounds like a Dark Lord.
He sounds like someone who should be obeyed.
You know what he sounds like to me?
I should probably get my axe, chop up your head, and see what's in there making that noise.
Maybe just the top of it.
There's two things you should do with that axe.
As this conversation's taking place, you hear this massive, echoing explosion right over your shoulders as you see a flash of light and heat brighten the courtyard around you.
Everyone in the vicinity looks up past.
You can see one of the three large towers that sits in the courtyard of this fortress.
The tower of Warchief Barfta is currently in flames, his chamber being burned as the thatch and mud that comprises its exterior are beginning to burn.
You can see now everyone's mobilizing around you, grabbing weapons as a series of arrows come arcing in from over one of the walls.
Three or four nearby uruk go (dying sounds) and fall to the ground, dead immediately.
I take a helmet off one and put it in my bag.
All right, what are you guys doing?
I take out a crossbow, do I see any intruders?
Isn't that where Barfta lives up there?
You glance around rapidly and you see people running back and forth and you can see guards along the wall, but the guards are firing inward.
You see three or four uruk up on the edge of the perimeter wall that are currently loading up their crossbows or shortbows and are ready to fire another volley into the crowd currently drinking.
Why are they firing at us?
I pick up my quarterstaff and start stomping towards the tower.
So as Mozuu's picking up the rear you can see other goblins and uruk rushing past.
You see another volley get loosed towards it.
I need all of you to make dexterity saving throws, please.
Both Mozuu and Arburuk manage to--
Mozuu and Arby, rushing forward, you manage to get behind Arby as the heavy plates of armor that surround your large, troll-like form, the arrows smash against.

You flex and tear them off as you rush forward towards the side of the tower before you now, the smoke billowing off the top of the inferno.
I step in front of Skak here to try to block him from any more arrows coming.
I could have used my Deflect Missiles!
You need to be on your game!

So as you guys are rushing forward now, the crowd swarming up behind you, you glance over to the right and you can see pouring out of the back side of this tower, three very brutish-looking uruk with bulging muscles.
They have dark helmets on and this faint glow in their eyes as they charge in and start cleaving into nearby allies of yours that were drinking not a moment ago.
Am I far enough away to pick one off with my crossbow?
It is currently in a scuffle with somebody, so I'll let you get sneak attack damage if you want to.
All right, so on top of the six, 17.

So I jab him right between the legs.

With advantage, because he is currently--
All right, roll damage on that with sneak attack.

12 points of damage to his gut!
With that, as he's currently standing there swinging wide, missing Eden as he rushes past, he begins to give chase.

Of this group, of us four!
Well, I was thinking I could lead?
This is a democracy in which I lead.

You're faster than the rest, so you dart up towards the top of the stairs.

And gets two attacks, but the first one, a natural two, misses the first one.

He was this glob that I killed two towns over.
He would always write a Z on his victims.
So I'm going to try and write an E. (grunts)
With an exposed muscular torso, it takes a lot of pressure to try and cut someone with a quarterstaff.

Can I make a lowercase E?
With that, he looks down at the E and you just push him off the edge of the stairs and he tumbles.

As they all do when they see your might.
He said he was so scared of you, Mozuu!
Oh, yeah, there's two things people do when they're scared of me.
At which point you guys have now caught up to the back of Ur-Eden, and you guys climb up the rest of the stairs.
You can now look over the side of the walls, and you can see a number of the uruk within this fortress have now overtaken a lot of the marauding, arriving traitors that had begun to attack.
And it seems like most of the uprising's being quelled, however no one has gotten to the tower as quick as you.
Do the uprisers, the rebels, look different?

If we rescue him, we're heroes.

Yes, tell us if it's you.

If you're not on fire, say-- You know, just say whatever you like.

I try to break it down.
Okay, go ahead and roll damage!
With your giant maul, you slam down with this gargantuan hammer into the burning wood.

You can see a lot of the silks that he keeps-- For the point here, as the leader of this portion of the marauder tribe, Barfta likes nice things.
Even glancing inside you've gotten little glimpses of the inside of his chamber here and there, and you can see gold spoils adorning taken cabinets and boxes and crates left around.
There's just a large pile of somewhat loosely comfortable materials that you scoff at the idea of such comfort, but silently in the back of your head, you're like, I bet that's nice.
Can we see where Barfta is in here?
You do actually see the far wall is an open hole, destroyed by one of the earlier detonations.
You can see the entry point was the other side of this tower.

And there in the center you see Warchief Barfta, muscles swollen in rage.

He's just like gone feral in his face at this point.
Does he look like he's in trouble?
Glancing in, you can see he looks wounded on one arm, one arm looks like it has a few gashes, but for the most part seems to be not too worse for wear.
As soon as the door bashes in, he's like growling at this one uruk on the ground who's partially broken with one eye swollen shut.
Glances over, looks in your direction, What're you doing?
Okay, I try to break through the rest of the door.
Okay, so make an athletics check.

You all step into the center of the chamber and there the warchief is still clutching his assassin on the ground and he's grinning and going, You stupid shrak, who sent you?
What fool dares raise arms against me?
Looks back at the rest of you with this look of rage in his eyes.
The Warchief, You there, make yourself useful and get my information!
He throws the wounded assassin at your feet who tumbles.
He starts coughing and trying to get up.
Oh, I step on him, but not to kill him, to hold him in place.
A very big foot right on his chest, he's now like pinned on the ground pushing against the foot, but not able to get any ground.
He's looking up at you, eyes wide from the pressure.
Can you answer some questions for us, please?
Why are you being so polite?
I'll walk over, I'll get real close to him.
Hello friend, my name is Mozuu the Chosen.

You see all this around here?

I start looking around the room and forget that I'm actually standing on him and I put my full weight down.
